work_exp:
[u"Assistant Vice-President and Chief Information Security Officer
WellStar Health System
January 2016 to September 2017
Led information security governance program for largest healthcare organization in Georgia. Supported 2016 merger of 11 hospitals and over 250 practice locations into a single $3 billion per year healthcare system. Elevated the information security program from a focus on technical issues to a strategic perspective that supports and enables world-class healthcare while identifying and managing risk.

• Created a risk management and assessment program based on NIST SP 800-30 and 800-39 to translate information risks into business risks and impacts to inform senior executives.
• Oversaw external auditors' assessments of compliance with the HIPAA Security Rule and PCI.
• Led development and execution of security-related corrective action plans with business owners.
• Mentored the IT Department and other core business units to improve and mature processes.
• Identified and advocated for deployment of targeted technologies that safeguard critical systems.
• Provided ongoing, comprehensive security awareness training for staff.
• Stabilized the Information Security Department by redefining roles and hiring qualified staff.
• Developed executive-level presentations for WellStar Board of Directors and Board subcommittees.

Technologies recommended and used included:
• Rapid 7 tool suite for PCI scanning, server vulnerability scanning, application vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, and vulnerability management.

• Splunk for Security with structured threat Information expression/trusted automated exchange of intelligence information (STIX/TAXII) threat feed.
• Symantec suite including VIP two factor authentication, antivirus, endpoint protection, data leakage protection (DLP), and Altiris for patch management.
• AirWatch for mobile device management.
• Office 365 Suite including Active Director Federated Services (ADFS) and Smarsh email archiving.
• Palo Alto Firewalls with cloud access security broker (CASB) capabilities.
• WebSense and Zscaler for web security.
• Tanium for endpoint security and cyber threat hunting.", u'Chief Information Security Officer
Georgia Technology Authority (GTA)
January 2005 to January 2016
Led state of Georgia's information security governance program, overseeing strategy, policy development, compliance, and risk assessment/acceptance processes. Advised the governor's office, policymakers, state CIO, and agency executives on emerging technologies (cloud services, BYOD, mobile), IT security trends, risk reduction, regulatory compliance, and investment prioritization.

• Integrated information security requirements into infrastructure outsourcing agreements valued at $1.2 billion, yielding savings of over $180 million.
• Conceived and implemented the cybersecurity component of the state's Fusion Center, collaborating with federal authorities, National Guard, GBI, and GEMA to proactively detect and address cyber-terrorism.
• Gained governor's support for creation of State Government Systems Cybersecurity Review Board tasked with prioritizing information risk management statewide.
• Brought state into compliance with PCI security standards. Remediation achieved rapidly, $7 million under budget, and reduced recurring credit card expenses by 50%.
• Created and maintained over 100 policies and standards to support maturity of state security practices based on FISMA framework and ITIL practices.

work_exp:
[u"Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer
HyperMach Aerospace Industries - Houston, TX
October 2008 to Present
Chief Executive, visionary, Founder with full P&L and operations responsibility for the development of the worlds first and fastest Hypersonic, Hybrid, Business Jet (HHYBJ). Private ndustry commercialization through private equity, sovereign wealth, venture capital and strategic backing to IPO, bringing to market a hybrid hypersonic business jet with overall operations and general management of $1.4 billion. Achievement of potential sales on order books currently to $400 million. Operations in Texas, California, Montreal, London, United Kingdom and Toulouse, France. Management of operations, strategy/vision, finance, capital securities and private equity capital raises, human capital, intellectual property (14 patents-awarded, 69 pending), supply chain development and aircraft program management and technology development, through all phases of aircraft design, engineering and development and FAA/ICAO certification. Creation, formulation and development of six strategic industry partners, and private equity partnerships, covering manufacturing, finance, global top-tier C-level executive relations of supporting Blue-Chip and Fortune 100 and 500 Companies. The company has done or is doing business with NASA, US Air Force, DOD, airframe OEMs, propulsion and power OEMs, Sovereign Wealth Funds, Pension Funds, Asian, Middle Eastern, and Indian individual and family wealth funds supporting growth. Company is currently in preliminary design stage of the HyperStar aircraft HHYBJ, with the build of the sub-scale flight vehicle demonstrator beginning in 2017. Over five years secured international partners for HyperMach, including substantial technology and component development for the entire HyperStar program, including propulsion. HyperMach is in Mission Review with the Department of Defense and one large global defense partner as an equity partner, for a specific unmanned sub-scale aircraft platform (component of the company's sub-scale demonstrating platform), for the development of a high-speed deep strike bomber/weapon. H-MAGJET hybrid turbo-ramjet engine program is under review for the USAF Sixth Generation Advanced Fighter Program by two top tier engine OEMs and partners.
The Company has 10 management and technology Team members, with 12 contract consulting
engineers in partner companies in five global locations.", u'Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer
SonicBlue Aerospace, Inc - Portland, ME
June 2004 to Present
Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, with P&L responsibility, private equity, and equity partners campaign oversight/strategy to IPO of a growth stage aerospace and defense engine propulsion company. Management of operations, finance, contracts, intellectual property (over 118 patents, 14 awarded, 69 pending ), oversight of major systems engineering, R&D, focused on major systems integration of a $860 million hybrid plasma ram-turbojet system for propulsion, termed H-MAGJET. H-MAGJET is a dedicated program in supporting the HyperStar hypersonic hybrid business jet of its sister company, HyperMach. In earlier stage developments the company has multi-market uses for small hybrid turbine designs of its MAGJET engine family to generate early revenue, some to its aerospace partners in superconducting airborne power and clean sheet designs for rotorcraft, unmanned aerial systems, hypesonic missiles and Air Force/DARPA supersonic and hypersonic small scale hybrid propulsion systems in micro-programs of $30.0 million to $70.0 million. Beyond this program a follow-on secondary program is HYPERDRIVE propulsion, a radial plasma scramjet rocket engine system capable of Mach 8 is in development, to capitalize on space exploration and launch payload to Low Earth Orbit, in single stage to orbit configuration called HySTAR, with the technology and program owned by HyperMach. HyStar is in a 15 year privately and government funded program for a future very high-speed launch vehicle, under development at HyperMach Aerospace Industries, Inc. with vehicle markets to the US military, UK and European customers. Customers currently coming under contract/or under contract include DOD, US Navy, and US Air Force, ONERA, EADS/Astrium. Commercial markets under development include the space tourism market, private satellite launch, private business jet markets and single aisle wide body jet markets, and military fighter aircraft future programs. Valuation comes from demonstrating full-scale engine component demonstrators and licensing core technologies to engine OEMS, followed by prototypes of H-MAGJET in 2021, planned expenditure up to $460M, revenue on contract option agreements to $2.4 billion of revenue in 2020. Oversee seven aerospace industry propulsion partnerships for HYPERDRIVE systems, and hypersonic air-breathing combined cycle engine development program, H-MAGJET. The Company has 27 employees and another 12 contract consultants in three geographic locations world-wide.', u'Senior Vice President/Senior Partner of Arthur D. Little Innovation and Technology Group
Arthur D. Little, Inc - Boston, MA

Leadership, general management, business operations and business development with P&L of $400M, with responsibility of diverse multi-industry Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 Client Programs in aerospace, automotive, energy, high tech, biotech and pharma of ADLs Innovation and Technology Division (ITD). Full P&L responsibility of $480M in revenue, 26 direct Vice President reports, and 420 employees. Client capture and revenue focus was on strategy, M&A, business process and improvement, design, engineering, prototyping, low-rate production, financial modeling, operations, logistics, product marketing, strategic partnering. Military customer focus was for UAVs, weapons systems, sensors and cybersecurity. Also general management and full P&L responsibility as President of ITDs largest business unit, Electrical Engineering, Communications and Information Technology (ECIT), managing 65 employees and $75 million in revenue. Achieved record revenue, exceeded 60% of gross profit in 2001 and 2002. Set track record of 23% growth in net operating income in 2002, set profitability from 6% to 21% in 2003. Generating $48.9 million in new revenue, and 76 new client companies covering aerospace, automotive, alternative energy, IT, software, hardware, communications technologies and commercialized products. work_exp:
[u'Sr VP of Engineering
STAQ - Baltimore, MD
July 2016 to Present
SUMMARY

Responsible for all technology efforts and budget in the company, including Integrations, Data Engineering, UI/UX design and development, APIs, and R&D.

DETAILS

Responsible for all technology efforts and budget in the company, including Integrations, Data Engineering, UI/UX Design and Development, Product Development, Operations, and R&D. This includes on-site staff in Baltimore as well as distributed teams in India, Mexico, Colombia, and Venezuela.

Managed and negotiated all contracts with third party vendors including outsourcing contracts, technology vendors, and staffing firms.

Improved the existing processes for hiring, developing and deploying code, and planning, including introducing roadmaps and statements of work.

Introduced new metrics for measuring the success of Engineering and STAQ as a whole and drive the business to execute against those metrics, leading to both more efficient spend and utilization of resources.

Actively provide oversight for the architecture, design, and development of the STAQ Platform.

Envisioned and delivered the next version of the STAQ platform and expanded the team and technology footprint to execute against that vision, including moving the underlying architecture from a limited scale, batch based platform to a scalable real time platform leverage technology including Hadoop, Apache NiFi, HAWQ, and other related technologies.

Participate in and drive Business Development efforts through reviews of technology, companies, and strategic planning sessions.

Provide support for Sales and Marketing through participation in customer/prospect meetings and speaking engagements.

Participate as an individual contributor when needed, including managing the cloud infrastructure in AWS and GCS, IT infrastructure such as mail and source control systems, and implementing NiFi data work flows and new NiFi processors.', u'VP of Engineering
kCura Corporation / Content Analyst Company - Reston, VA
March 2016 to July 2016
SUMMARY

Responsible for all Engineering, Product Management, Test Engineering and other IT functions at Content Analyst. This includes determining, implementing and enforcing new processes within the company.

DETAILS

Created and managed to the 30/60/90 day Integration Plan once Content Analyst was purchased by kCura

Established a new delivery cadence at Content Analyst to match the cadence of kCura.

Successfully integrated the Content Analyst team into the larger company within the first 30 days and delivered new / updated products using the new development lifecycle.

Worked with peers on the management team to determine new organization structures and customer
migration strategies.

Delivered an architectural plan to move the existing Java / Scala monolithic analytics platform to a collection of Scala-based services capable of running on-premise, in MS Azure, or on Amazon AWS, while
integrating more closely with the kCura Relativity suite of products.', u'CTO
Leverege, LLC - Germantown, MD
February 2015 to February 2016
SUMMARY

Responsible for staff and planning related to technology related functions at Leverege, including Development, R&D, and Operations and Support. This includes implementing and enforcing processes that allow Leverege to operate efficiently and communicate clearly across the organization and with customers.

DETAILS

Provided oversight for the architecture, design, and development of the Leverege product offering, a highly performant Internet of Things (IoT) ingestion, analytic and visualization platform. In this role I am responsible for building a team of top performers and participating as a member of the team as needed, which includes designing the overall architecture, technology research and implementation, writing white papers and design documents, and performing code reviews. The Leverege IoT platform utilizes technology such as Apache Kafka, ElasticSearch, HBase, Java, and ReactJS and interoperates with other IoT platforms including those from Google, Amazon, ThingWorx, and Telit.

Worked with platform and service vendors as well as customers to build partnerships, including companies such as SAP/NS2, Hortonworks, Stanley, Raytheon, Link Labs and others. Activities include establishing technical partnerships, business development efforts, and assisting with technical evaluations on behalf of customers and partners.

Responded to solicitations, built proof of concepts, and demonstrated systems for various federal agencies that included United States Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) and Department of Homeland Security (DHS).', u'Vice President of Engineering
Lotame Solutions - Elkridge, MD
May 2008 to January 2015
SUMMARY

Responsible for all Engineering, R&D, Quality Assurance, and Engineering Support functions, during a time of rapid growth of the company that saw a 400% increase in staffing and an 1800% growth in revenue

DETAILS

Responsible for all staff and financial planning related to Engineering, R&D, Test Engineering, Database, and Engineering Support functions during a time of rapid growth in the company that included large increases in both company size and revenue. Overall Engineering staff increased fourfold (not including offshore contracts), while adding teams such as a Test Engineering (QA) team and an Engineering Support team. I also utilized contract and off-site staff when necessary. Company revenue grew from $1MM / year to $20MM during this time.

Improved the existing implementations Agile development methods, creating new scalable processes that were tweaked as the company continued to grow. This includes implementing new processes for injecting R&D projects into the regular engineering cycle, working with external / outsourced resources, and working effectively with a service desk / client services team.

Provided support for Sales and Marketing through participation in customer/prospect meetings, speaking engagements, and participation in conferences. I also launched and participated in Business Development efforts as various opportunities arose.

Provided oversight for the architecture, design, and development of the Lotame Crowd Control product line, including designing and implementing an agile process for designing, coding, testing and delivering code to the Operations team and integrating that process with the other business units at Lotame.

Primary architect for several core components including the common security model, a solution which leverages REST web services (via Jersey), Spring Security, and LDAP based Authentication (via OpenDS).

Responsible for developing prototypes, tools, and frameworks for use in the product line using technologies such as Docker, Java, PHP, Apache Hadoop, Apache Hive, Cascading, Pig (from Yahoo), LDAP, OpenSocial, Protocol Buffers, Thrift, Cassandra and Pentaho. This also includes stepping in and writing code, test cases, test scripts with Selenium, or performing DBA tasks if the teams need and extra set of hands. Also responsible for creating a testing framework, leveraging Selenium, for the Test Engineering team.', u'Director of Information Technology
UniStar Nuclear Energy / Constellation Energy Group - Baltimore, MD
April 2007 to May 2008
SUMMARY

Led all of the IT efforts for UniStar, a joint venture between Constellation Energy and EDF, including identifying, architecting, budgeting, and beginning implementation of a one-of-a-kind IT platform for the licensing, construction, operation, and decommissioning of nuclear power stations.

DETAILS

Provided oversight for the development, deployment, and support of all IT systems for UNE, including providing the IT interface between all partner companies. This includes developing a vision and plan to create a Product Lifecycle (PLM) and Enterprise Fleet Platform that supports all phases of nuclear power plant development and operation, from licensing through operation and decommissioning of individual plants.

Manage the architecture processes and governance initiatives and provide direction over research activities and technology evaluations, including directing and controlling the evaluation, negotiation, and selection of software, consulting, and contracting services.

Developed and maintain a multi-million dollar IT budget and business plan, working with partner companies to develop an integrated IT strategy and business plan.

Responsible for pre- and post-sale activities with UNE customers related to the UNE Enterprise Fleet Platform. Duties include marketing UniStar IT and the IT Platform vision and benefits as well as continued communication with customers on overall progress.

Responsible for selecting a strategic IT partner for UNE, determining the nature of the relationship, then negotiating and managing a multi-year, multi-million dollar outsourcing contract with the partner.', u'Director of Enterprise Architecture /
Constellation Energy Group (Constellation Generation Group) - Baltimore, MD
March 2007 to October 2007
SUMMARY

Responsible for providing architectural guidance and oversight for IT projects with the Constellation Generation Group (CGG), this included both nuclear and non-nuclear assets.

DETAILS

Provide, in partnership with others, governance over IT related projects and a vision of IT operations and goals, leading to a better understanding of how IT supports and is related to the business.

Play a key role as the CGG and Corporate Architecture representative to the CEG ITIL advisory team, which was instituted to drive more operational efficiency into CEG IT and provide better value to the overall company.

Served as the point of contact for cross business unit IT initiatives related to performance improvement, mobile technology enablement, collaborative technologies, and other efforts.', u'Enterprise Architect / Supervisor
Constellation Energy Group - Baltimore, MD
June 2004 to March 2007
SUMMARY

Participated in several roles at Constellation Energy, including Enterprise Architect roles for Baltimore Gas and Electric and Constellation Generation Group where responsibilities included architecting and overseeing enterprise deployments of large IT systems. Roles also included managing teams for knowledge management and corporate integrations and managing multi-million dollar budgets.

ENTERPRISE ARCHITECTURE

Provided technical guidance and oversight for IT projects within the Constellation Generation Group (CGG) and Baltimore Gas & Electric (BG&E). Responsibilities include participating in reviews, generating architectural artifacts, and providing implementation and strategy guidance to leaders and team members based on an understanding of the requirements of the business users.

Created new IT review processes and artifacts within CGG to improve the ability of the IT groups to partner with the business unit, while improving repeatability and predictability.

Developed architectural and integration strategies for MRO Maximo 5.2 / MXES and Primavera for the corporation (BG&E and CGG). This includes plans for integrating to systems that include Oracle Financials, WorkBrain (Time Entry), Spescom, and PeopleSoft, as well a number of other internal systems.

Delivered a series of engagement and strategy documents that cover topics including the architecture engagement model, Service Oriented Architectures (SOA), SOA Governance (UDDI, security, and web service standards), enterprise portal standards, and event driven monitoring.

Determined a strategy for BG&E to integrate integrating .NET services into the corporate portal with WSRP.

Provided guidance and guidelines regarding software and development practices used throughout all of the companies that comprise CEG as a member of the Constellation Architectural Oversight Committee.

Designed several prototypes that leverage TIBCO, .NET (1.1 and 2.0) / C#, Java, UDDI and Windows Mobile devices to investigate applicability of the technology and provide development examples for developers. A bug in Visual Studio 2005 was uncovered through these prototypes, and later fixed by Microsoft.


INFORMATION SYSTEM AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT

Managed several groups and projects with budgets ranging up to approximately $4 million, including software purchases, vendor engagements, and staffing.

Responsible for incremental improvements in CEG’s development by introducing new methodologies, processes and tools, which ultimately saved the company significant time and money. These improvements include agile processes, including SCRUM, and the addition of new open source testing, development, and tracking tools, including JMeter, XPlanner, Maven, and Eclipse, among others.

Directed the delivery and development of the Constellation Enterprise Portal, including internal and external sites utilizing the portal. The portal is based on Vignette Application Portal (VAP) with the Vignette Content Management System (VCM) supplying web content management. Vignette Application Builder (VAB) is also used for some portion of portlet development.

Responsible for moving the development teams towards a more standards-based direction with the introduction/ added emphasis of standards to the portal development stack, including JSR 168 and WSRP.

Provided oversight for the delivery and development of several applications utilizing Documentum as a document management system and work flow engine. These applications span various areas, including Credit and Collections, Accounts Payable, engineering documentation, and process and procedure documentation for CGG.

Managed the development of MS SharePoint web parts and extensions to base SharePoint functionality.

Guided the design and implementation of the Enterprise Message Bus, based on the TIBCO JMS Server and TIBCO BusinessWorks and serve as the initial architect of the first system integrated with the Enterprise Message Bus, Documentum, and the Enterprise Portal.', u'Development Manager
Witness Systems, Inc - Alpharetta, GA

INFORMATION SYSTEMS

ENGINEERING

Supported Duke Power during an outage at the Oconee Nuclear Station by inspecting and cleaning feedwater nozzles at Unit 2."]

B-Side provides film market research, marketing, and distribution services to filmmakers, producers, and distributors.

B-Side's Festival Genius platform powers more than 200 film festival websites including the Sundance and AFI film festivals, servicing more than 4 million attendees annually. Festival Genius provides web and mobile scheduling and ticketing services, attendee calendars, optimized scheduling, ratings and reviews, and personalized recommendations. Through Festival Genius, B-Side has built a database of 250k registered members, capturing audience intelligence on 50k feature films.

B-Side leverages its audience data to provide advanced market research services to producers and distributors. The Critical Genius analytical engine identifies films with maximum earning potential based on festival screening data. B-Side's Theatrical- On-Demand platform enables organizations and individual enthusiasts to host their own digital screenings of feature films. Theatrical-On-Demand delivered the widest single-day opening ever for a documentary, generating $3.5M in gross DVD sales & rentals on less than $8,000 marketing spend.

1983-1991, Various Organizations and Roles.
Before coming to the USA had a progressive career in engineering, software development, and technical management working primarily the civil engineering industry. Developed a number of software applications with complex algorithms and comprehensive UI. Founded and managed a profitable software development company.

LEADERSHIP STYLE HIGHLIGHTS
My management skills and leadership approach were formed in a process of delivering products and services to a broad variety of very demanding internal and external clients including large multinational organizations, medium to small sized business, and consumers. The list below offers brief insights into my leadership style:
* Business Needs over Technology. While I believe in elegant technology driven solutions and invest heavily in the architecture, design, and quality, I see technology as a support and facilitator to the business needs.
* Collaborative Organization. I believe in developing software in close collaboration with a broad range of stakeholders and devote significant efforts to building a culture of transparency across organization.
* Coach Management. I practice coach managing techniques in all aspects of the employment lifecycle, linking individuals' goals to the company objectives and enforcing accountability.
* Team over Individual. While I invest in hiring high caliber individual contributors and in their personal growth, I value the team synergies over an individual's potential.
* Right Tool for the Job. I do not have a bias towards specific technologies or methodologies, instead I practice a systematic analysis when making technology decisions.

TECHNOLOGY HIGHLIGHTS
Since mid 90s, my primary focus has been on running technology organizations responsible for support of internal systems, and development and implementation of mission-critical client/server and web-based systems and tools for their design, development, deployment and continuous operations including the following:
* Architecture, design, development and production support of SaaS systems and COTS products for enterprise clients and government entities in multiple industry verticals such as Healthcare, Automotive, and Retail;
* Design, development and market rollout of consumer applications with high usability requirements including web portals, mobile apps, and local Windows applications in variety of technologies and functional areas;
* API-based and traditional EAI-based system integration with enterprise systems such as Oracle, SAP and a variety of commercial and proprietary EMR, ERP, SCM, SFA and CRM systems;
* Establishing and operating high performance / high availability IT Infrastructure with full scale Disaster Recovery, Business Continuity, and Information Privacy and Security coverage in 24/7 environment;
* Software development, system implementation, quality assurance, production support, and application roll out methodologies including traditional waterfall and agile techniques in variety of organizational settings.
My strong technical background combined with the passion for leading technology organizations resulted in multitude of achievements such as building a large scale enterprise-class system that was named by the Gartner Group as "One of the Best eCommerce Systems in the World", founding of a startup named by the Giga Group "A hands-down leader in Electronic Commerce", and building the industry's first government-endorsed service for electronic delivery of regulatory materials that generated over $5MM revenue in the first year.']

[u"Director of IT Infrastructure

• Created and wrote IT policies and procedures with adherence to NIST guidelines & NFA/DFS regulations that eliminated ambiguity for the management and acceptable use of IT systems.
• Developed a threat hunting program to detect and identify advanced threat agents, resulting in constant monitoring for anomalous behavior against a baseline of sanctioned activity.

work_exp:
[u'VP of Manufacturing
Dayton Parts LLC - Harrisburg, PA
August 2016 to June 2017
Responsible for managing 2 locations of manufacturing. 1 in PA and one in OK. Responsible to decrease Man Hours Per Ton, Maintain Order Fill above 97%. Backfill previous positions within the company. Some of the key projects:
• Implement production tracking in both facilities utilizing Plant Metrics
• Design, Coordinate & Implement more ergonomic solutions in both manufacturing facilities
• While Sales increased over 30% in the first half of 2017, worked with Manufacturing to increase production by over 33%. Manufacturing output hit 104 TPD for May 2017 and was the highest output for both facilities since September 2015.
Hurdles:
◦ Low unemployment rate at both facilities
◦ Wage freeze
◦ Large percentage of new hires
◦ Average mark up of manufacturing product lowered to increase sales but no input given through manufacturing
• Started to develop system to track production & quality to help elminate paperwork as well as giving immediate feedback to Customer Service to help satisfy sales
• Order Fill
◦ Able to maintain goal of 97% + in PA facility
◦ In January of 2017 sales of OEM and Aftermarket started to climb. Various drop in orders and poor communication to the manufacturing facility in OK hurt order fill. Implemented plan to have all departments work much closer together each day and all communicated during a Tuesday meeting to help prioritize customer orders and provide feedback to the customer. Some improvement seen but the factor of huge sales uncontrolled by manufacturing, helped lower order fill. Was working on spreading out large orders to not only satisfy the big customer but also all smaller ones to try to keep customer satisfaction high
• Man Hour Per Ton (MHPT)
◦ PA facility - was stagnant around the 16 to 17 MHPT area. Was able to help coordinate communication with Supervision and Shop Employees to help reduce. In May 2017 was able to achieve 13.5 MHPT (of our 13.0 MHPT goal). Lowest monthly number on record (tracked since 1999)
◦ OK facility - started tracking about 2014 where the MHPT was around 40. Since taking over the role of VP, was able to progressively reduce fromt about 32 to 23.2 MHPT for May 2017. Again lowest monthly number on record. (interim goal was set at 25.0 MHPT)
• Capital & Improvement Projects
◦ Worked with a team consisting of PA & OK Plant Managers, Engineering Manager and Director of Product Engineering & Quality to prioritze and allocate resources to accomplish projects within a timely manner and control costs.
• Backfill Positions
◦ Engineering Manager - promoted Electrical Engineer to position and trained on several different aspects of the job
◦ Safety/Quality Coordinator - promoted Engineering Clerk to take some of the basic duties that were previously performed
◦ TS Coordinator - worked with Director of Product Engineering & Quality to find candidate to assume TS responsibilities within our OK facility due to most of OE production manufactured there
◦ Director of Quality - helped to find candidate to enhance our Quality efforts between facilities - eventually was promoted to Director of Product Engineering & Quality as described above
• Strategic Planning
◦ Worked with the rest of Staff and developed plan to improve overall health of the company
* Developed and presented presentations to give to the Board of Directors
* Updated and controlled various projects to save the company money
* Prioritized, delegated to the teams, worked with all team members and outside companies and tracked progress to meet agreed upon deadlines
• Results - 100% of quantified projects met their deadlines and cost savings
◦ Part of team that reviewed OK facility to consider acquistion (part of previous position as Mfg Engineering Manager)
• Communication
◦ Frequent trips to Durant, OK facility
◦ Trips to various other suppliers
* Including purchased parts & fabrication projects
◦ Trips to other possible company acquisitions', u'Manufacturing Engineering Manager/Quality, Safety & Environmental Coordinator

Provided a Quality manual & system which helped reduce scrap & rework, etc. relative to an overall reduction in man hours per ton by over 40%. Provided a Safety system whereas the company now works as a team and the accident frequency & severities have dropped dramatically. Continue to work with local and state agencies to keep the company compliant with regulations. Continue to strive to recycle wastes as much as possible. work_exp:
[u'VP of Semiconductor and BioPharma Divs
RMB Products Inc
January 2011 to January 2017
Responsible for sales,
engineering and custom manufacturing of high performance plastic components used in production of integrated
circuits and biopharmaceuticals / biologics. Led innovation and commitment to meeting exacting standards for this
manufacturer of high performance engineered polymers and thermoplastic solutions, including rotationally moldable
resins for demanding applications in the semiconductor and pharmaceutical industries. Negotiated prices and service agreements with key suppliers. Headed team of 16.
Managed portfolio of 12 accounts representing $4.5M in sales. Evaluated market trends and allocated marketing
budget. Designed sales forecasting and segment strategies. Qualified prospects and sales opportunities in targeted
markets. Quoted prices, credit terms and other bid specifications. Led cross-functional teams in creating impactful
messaging, demand-generation programs and sales tools. Formulated custom business plans for incoming account
managers.
• Drove growth without increasing costs, ultimately securing major client. The capital investment firm
that had acquired RMB had set a very aggressive five-year growth goal. While driving growth is a difficult
task by itself, the job was made more challenging by the requirement that further capital expenditures and new hires would be unavailable until new sales were generated. In order to promote sales growth without
increasing headcount, negotiated advantageous commission rates with and developed a new US-based
representative and distribution network with existing experience with and sales to semiconductor OEMs,
RMB's target market. Contracted with additional representatives in Europe, South Korea and Israel. Within
six months, the domestic market representatives were generating a total of over $1M in annualized sales,
including a relationship with LAM Research that within three years became the division's #1 client with yearly revenues of over $3M. Led cross-functional sales, engineering, quality and manufacturing teams in
positioning RMB as LAM's preferred supplier in only ⅔ the time usually required. As preferred supplier,
achieved and maintained an 8.32 score in a supplier pool in which 80% of LAM's vendors earned an average score of 17. Secured LAM's "World Class" supplier designation.
• Created lucrative new market for advanced technology. Led RMB teams in development of a new
rotomolded container using a new machine. Although interested, numerous companies did not want to
"risk" being the first to use new cryogenic storage container technology. Identified technology "champions" in the industry; officials in the manufacturing R&D division of major biopharmaceutical company
Merck individuals senior enough to drive allocation of resources and funds, and hungry enough to pursue
this market disruptor for the next two-to-three years. Because this was a new technology for manufacturing a new component with direct contact with injectable pharmaceutical solutions, needed to satisfy both
Merck's internal quality auditors, scientists and supplier management teams; and the uncompromising
reviewers at the FDA. Secured $2.5M from Merck for development of the new technology and its
associated testing systems, satisfying the RMB board's aversion to allocating capital funds. Participated as a principal in filing a joint patent. Negotiated Merck's licensing of RMB in perpetuity to manufacture and sell the new container technology with a minimal (1% of the sell price) royalty per container.
• Created marketing collaboration driving new product introduction. Refocused from successful
technology development to marketing new product. Sought a go-to-market partner already established in the industry, ready to compete with current disposable storage solutions, offering a current product to
manufacture off-the-shelf and custom silicon top works. Identified Meissner Filtration as the partner
motivated to "take the ball and run." Meissner quickly proved themselves to be focused, diligent and responsive, committing funds and resources to completing the validation binder for this solution set to
launch at Interphex 2018, the country's premier pharmaceutical, biotechnology and device development,
manufacturing and commercialization event.
• Negotiated key supply chain provisions that protected vital client relationship. After securing
contracts with LAM Research for the supply of custom-molded Teflon tanks, needed to ensure an adequate
supply of PFA from a customer-imposed exclusive supplier. Historically, this material has cyclical supply
issues, due to manufacturing and market issues. Based on customer's forecast demand, successfully
negotiated with Daikin and GSI representatives to spread the risk. Agreed that each company would keep a
minimum amount of material in stock at all times, and executed a long-term agreement with both companies. Quickly benefitted from this foresight and preparation as Daikin found itself unable to
manufacture powdered PFA resin when the company was severely disrupted by the 2011 tsunami affecting
Japan's northern coast. However, due to the stock carried by all three companies by prior agreement,
RMB's ability to supply molded tanks to LAM Research was unaffected.
• Further cemented relationship with valued customer by enabling them to meet their own customer
delivery obligations when other suppliers had failed them. RMB's client LAM Research faced a
shortage of compression molded PVDF provided by other suppliers, threatening to delay shipments of their
deposition tools. RMB did not stock PVDF in the needed grade, but did use several grades of Nylon in the laser-sintering department. Determined that RMB could sinter its six-month supply of rotomold grade
fluoropolymer available in inventory. Working with R&D team, made usable samples available within two
weeks. The demand for these parts is estimated to exceed $7M annualized for 2018.', u"Program Manager
RMB Products Inc
January 2008 to January 2011
Led engineering and manufacturing teams producing
plastic components for the semiconductor industry. Created better forecasting tools that prevented over and under inventory conditions during extreme cyclical swings in semiconductor industry. Developed new products for and
opened new markets in industries with stringent cleanliness requirements. Collaborated with sales team.
• Identified and pursued new market, rebuilding shrinking revenue. Worked closely with sales in actively
addressing the cyclical nature of the semiconductor industry's negative effect in revenue. 9/11 worsened the decline even further, resulting in an approximately 65% loss of revenue year-over-year. Took the initiative to identify and open new revenue streams. Performed high-kevel market investigation into
industries that have strict production facility cleanliness requirements, much like the semiconductor
industry. Focused the company on biopharmaceuticals and food pasteurization. Contacted the Director of
Engineering for Avure Technologies, resulting in an agreement to manufacture a basket used in their high
pressure food processing (HPP) equipment. Avure propagated the new basket design across their entire
product offering, resulting in over $500K in yearly sales. Also worked with the Director for New
Technologies at Glaxo-Smith-Kline, leading to business agreement to develop a new container to be used in cryogenic storage and transport of biologic compounds. Introduction of a disposable rigid container with the advantages of a bag but with lower capital equipment costs continues to be a market disruptor. GSK
became an important customer for RMB with over $1M in yearly sales. Earned recognition as co-inventor as GSK and RMB jointly filed for patent protection. This product line became the precursor for other
reusable containers made of Teflon. Another customer (Centocor) was captured with this line, adding yet more revenue to the rejuvenated sales channel.", u"Engineering Product Manager
RMB Products Inc
January 1996 to January 2008
Strengthened manufacturing methodology.
Increased revenue and profitability by 35% and 45% respectively.
• Retained important customer, facilitating annualized sales jump from $150K to $550K that to grow. Avure Technologies liked the quality of RMB's baskets used in their HPP machines, but they were facing market pressure to cut prices due to availability of a competitor's lower cost version of
RMB's offering. Avure was considering contracting another molder to make the cheaper version. RMB's
nylon-based products were technically superior to competitor's HDPE-based product, and did not risk
damaging Avure's hydro pressure chambers. But even though RMB's baskets lasted over 20 times longer under normal use, they still could not command a 3X price premium. Quickly addressed the issue of nylon
costing 15X the price of competitor's HDPE. Determined that RMB's Aerospace Division generated large
amounts of scrap nylon, many times the volume of RMB Semiconductor and Biopharmaceutical Division's
production needs. Worked with Materials Engineering to compound these nylon remnants into micro pellets
that could be used for rotational molding. Reduced materials cost from $20 per pound to $0.48 per pound,
less than half of the cost of the competitor's HDPE. Quickly reestablished RMB's ability to compete on price with the HDPE baskets, dramatically increasing demand.
• Cut costs while optimizing throughput and productivity. Applied technical skills to resolving an ongoing
productivity problem. There was a quality issue with the wafer carrier line. The process called for bonding of ETFE bars. The entire surface was to be lined with resin in powder form, but the bars would drift away from the desired position during the lining stage. Throughput was running at an unacceptable 65%. The
problem needed to be resolved, but due to high production requirements, all R&D would have to be done without interrupting production. Changed the bonding process, and heating and machining methods.
Eliminated variability problems. Reduced total touch time by 50%. Reduced scrap while increasing
throughput from 65% to 98%. Customer was so pleased with this delivery and quality improvement that
they never requested a reduction in cost."]

[u"Sr Director of Engineering
GE Digital - Boston, MA
March 2017 to Present
GE Digital is a leading software company for the Industrial Internet, reimagining industry's infrastructure by connecting software, apps and analytics to industrial businesses. I was responsible for Brilliant Analytics, a part of the Brilliant Manufacturing System (BMS). Leveraged Predix (GE's CloudFoundry-based platform) and Predix Studio to build an interactive, customizable application for ingesting manufacturing process data, calculating and displaying industry-specific KPI's (eg, Availability, Capacity Utilization, MTTR, MTBF, OEE), and visualizing and correlating manufacturing and asset data for root-cause analysis.", u"Sr Director of Engineering
EnerNOC - Boston, MA
April 2014 to December 2016
Direct management responsibility for several geographically-distributed Engineering, QA, DevOps, and ProdOps teams whose responsibilities were developing, testing, deploying, and monitoring EnerNOC's IoT Big Data Analytics Platform, responsive SaaS web applications, large-scale Oracle database systems, and Business
Intelligence reporting. Specific accomplishments include:
● Platform Rewrite: Worked with Chief Architect and CTO to provide coaching , technical guidance, and communication facilitation, for 10 teams during a 7-month rewrite of EnerNOC's IoT Big Data platform and SaaS-based web application. The teams experimented with and selected the new stack: AWS's serverless components Lambda, Kinesis, DynamoDB, and Redshift; AngularJS, NodeJS, and Looker for the visualization, analytics, and BI mobile-responsive web application; ForgeRock IAM for a new
authentication and authorization component; and the Neo4J graph database for modeling business domain objects and for mapping role-based data access and aggregation.
● DevOps Culture: Oversaw the merging of 2 different engineering cultures (one aimed at production stability and one aimed at R&D) into a single DevOps culture with a strong bias toward continuous improvement, Behavior-Driven Development, and Automated testing. Worked with change agents in both camps to communicate and set up appropriate guidelines for tracking success of the roll-out,", u"VP Engineering
ChoiceStream, Inc. - Boston, MA
January 2011 to January 2014
Managed the engineering, QA, and SysOps teams responsible for CS's recommendation engine and advertising audience targeting platform.
● Architecture: Technical leader during the design and implementation of a Big Data, NoSQL-based complex event processing system to support Choicestream's display advertising business. The system processed hundreds of millions of impression and demographic data events per day with low latency to support the data science team's campaign optimizing algorithms for real-time bidding (RTB).

● SysOps: Responsible for managing the operations of ChoiceStream's backend servers and data centers. Introduced a DevOps culture by removing barriers between teams. Improved team responsiveness to critical production failures by introducing a ProdOps Kanban board. Also increased system performance by prioritizing work identified from root-cause analyses to elimiante repeat failures.

Key Technologies: NoSQL databases Cassandra, Hive, HBase, and Aerospike; Map/Reduce with Hive; Elasticsearch.", u"Director, Mobile Web Browser and Web Run Time Product Development

* Innovation and Leadership: Motivated and focused teams on user-driven results in a dyamic, fast-paced environment. Coached the Browser Leadership team on coordinating decision-making and communication priorities for setting priorities. Oversaw the innovation of Nokia's new touch-enabled browser.
* Strategy: Defined strategic product directions for the Web Browser and Web Run Time platform. The team re-engaged with open source community on WebKit engine development, set a new focus on innovation, and unified the browser code lines across dozens of devices and OS versions. Changed the US / India site strategy, resulting in newly-empowered autonomous product development teams in Boston, Mountain View, and Bangalore.
* Product Development: Expanded the scope of stakeholder engagement to include usability studies and Nokia-wide roadmap reviews. Worked with QA on expanding the automation coverage. Rolled-out Agile development process by creating new cross-funtional teams.
* Finance and Management: Directly responsible re-engineering a 160-person organization located in 3 locations and 2 countries into 2 new organizations separated along functional boundaries. Interviewed and nominated people into 12 new senior management positions. Oversaw the hiring of 148 total new employees. Planned and managed a $12 million yearly budget that included outsourcing and subcontracting expenses.

POWER ENGINEERS, Inc. /Burns and Roe Enterprises, Inc

Managed large multi-discipline Engineering Division consisting of 150- 400 engineers, designers, drafters and contract staff in several offices. Responsible for competitive proposals including strategy, "top-down" and
"bottoms-up" engineering and capital cost estimates, work plans, schedules, proposal preparation and presentations to clients. Responsible for several major clients.

Directed Engineering and Design efforts for a wide variety of new and upgraded facilities including:

Power Plants:

work_exp:
[u'VP - Core Infrastructure
Major League Baseball Advanced Media
January 2013 to Present
www.mlbam.com)
Advanced Media is the technology arm of Major League Baseball, charged with the goal of running all of MLB's
technology stacks for the 30 professional clubs. In addition, Advanced Media drives all the live linear, and VOD
streaming technologies for baseball, and high profile clients. MLB Advanced Media is widely regarded as the leader in streaming media with regards to live linear and are defining the RFC for live linear technology.

I head up an organization consisting of engineers, architects and operations that cover all aspects of the core- infrastructure. We set the standards with regards to automation, security, performance, deployments,
virtualization, OS, metrics, and datacenter & cloud architecture. I take a noticeable hands-on approach to leading and driving deliverables with a "do-as-I-do" attitude.

Client Highlights - Live & VOD Streaming:
• SONY, HBO, Riot Games, MLS, MLB, WWE, NHL, NFL, Twitter, NCAA, ESPN, Disney, Fox-Sports

Infrastructure Synopsis:
• Annual capital & operating budget management of ~$20M, Org level P&L.
• 44 on-prem datacenters in operations covering media, web, stadiums, and core services. Facilities span
the continental US, EU.
• ~100PB global storage footprint spanning solid state(NVMe,SSD), and spinning metal.
• AWS footprint spans east/west regions; 100+ VPC's between US east/west & EU.
• AWS Direct connect federation between the Web/Media on-prem facilities to core VPCs @10/40Gb waves.
• ~150 low latency linear encoding clusters for digital(SDI/IP) ingest acquisition to web capable media.
• Multiple tier-1 CDN partnerships leveraging backhauls to handle peak traffic at the edge of ~20Tbps.
• High throughput/concurrency metrics ingestion utilization multiple FOSS telemetry solutions.
• Virtualization: Vmware, Oracle OVM, Solaris Zones, RHEV/KVM, Docker(swarm/kubernetes).
• Crypto infrastructure comprised of internal CA's, OCSP's, HSM(FIPS-2,3) for media protection.
• Puppet, Ansilble, Jenkins, Rundeck make up the current Ci/Cd code deployment facility, core boot
strapping and standards enforcement.
• PCIv2,3 and SOC2 enforcement, and audit certification for our Web transactional facilities.
• AAA infrastructure: Ldap + AD federation, PKI, Kerberos, FreeIPA, SAML.
• Radar & Laser tracking systems infrastructure for "Field Tracking" and "Statcast" products. Generating
~19PB of perpetual data per season from 32 stadiums.
• Wifi (systems component) blanketing all 32 stadiums.

Infrastructure Delivery Highlights:
• Powered the live streaming of SuperBowl 51 for Fox Sport Go.
• Powering the Twitter video streaming effort with the latest highlights being Thursday Night Football,
DNC/RNC debates, and US Presidential debates.
• HBO Now launch, premiering Game of Thrones to 1M concurrent users.
• SONY Vue launch powering linear streaming to the Playstation(e.g. Cable box on the PS2/3)
• Broke the domestic streaming record for the 2014 World Cup with respect to concurrency & throughput
• WWE network launch along with the first ever pay-per-view Wrestle-mania over the internet to 1.2M
concurrent streams. Now in its third year of success.
• Statcast/Field tracking systems calculating 160/sec metrics per object on the field during any given
baseball game utilizing laser, radar, and high speed camera telemetry.

Friedrich Seifts Resume ~~~~~~~~~~~
Friedrich Seifts Resume', u'Director of IT
OpenSky
January 2011 to January 2013
www.opensky.com)
OpenSky is a merchant shopping platform specializing in connecting small businesses with customers.
Currently the platform is nearing 3-million active members, with traffic ~700 hits/sec. We have a total of
75 employees head-quartered in downtime NYC. Our development base is distributed across the country reaching into four states with total force of 35 full time developers working on Mobile, Backend,
Frontend. The core development platform revolves around PHP/MySQL/MongoDB/Java.

My role at OpenSky involved full ownership of "Core Infrastructure" for all HQ/Datacenter architecture,
engineering, and operations. I was charged with leading a team of L1-4 staff that entails staffing
authority, performance reviews, compensation reviews, bonus allotment, development plans, and member project management. Additionally, deployments, QA/testing, and Data Universe(Mongo/Mysql)
fall under my purview. My days are typically split 50/50%: Hands-on driving architecture & engineering,
remainder being delivery in some form of leadership capacity in Sr. management/delegation/stake
holder engagement/financials etc.

• Increased deployment velocity from bi-weekly releases to multiple daily releases to production.
• Increased our testing speed by implementing clustered Jenkins environments across all tiers.
• Decreased our full maintenance deployments by 90%, allowing us to serve during deployment
• Reduce overall deployment time from 2-3hrs, to under 5mins.
• Reduced overall payload build time from 60mins, to 12mins.
• Implementation of enterprise wide collaboration to notify of production deploy, and pass/fail of code branches and releases.
• Increased our QA and regression testing footprint by a 5-factor
• Implemented full prod data sets on all dev/qa environments, down from 5hrs to 90-sec
reset/restores
• Implemented "DeveloperVM"(prod-in-a-box) on VMware Fusion/VirtualBox to allow offline
development
• Full migration from github.com -> gitlab -> internal github:enterprise
• Implemented frame-work to allow for full Ci/Cd with "push-button" deployment, eventually leading
to full autonomous deployments to production(TBD)
• Implemented full scale monitoring solution with Bi to track/trace deployments that break
production
• Implemented a self-serve platform for Development to sandbox without needing Ops/Eng
involvement getting resource online in the enterprise
• Built core baseline OS stacks to accommodate production and development structure ensuring
that all baseline images are fully PCI compliance.
• Full PCI compliance on Hardware, Storage, and Virtualization stacks.
• Implemented accountability with full lock-down on production, granular authorization on Jenkins/selenium and all testing environments.
• Ground-up implementation of LDAP enterprise wide for access & authorization with full PKI and SUDO schema support.
• Full rebuild of the HQ Network infrastructure with LDAP backed VPN and IPSEC out to branch
offices.
• Root site availability increased from 91% to 5-9s uptime
• VMware Ent+, 10GBe front/backend segments, 56GB Infiniband fabric RoCee/RDMA
• 0% -> 95% fully virtualized infrastructure. Originally, entire DC was bare-metal
• Network re-architecture, to include DMZ, LAB, firewalled VLANs, load-balance critical
components
• Full RADIUS implementation: Port/WiFi/Geo-location agnostic
• Full re-Architecture of HQ: Power/Ping/Pipe/Racks/Cooling/Wiring, build from raw space
• Site-wide SSL abandonment, reduced avg. load times by ~3secs

Friedrich Seifts Resume ~~~~~~~~~~~
Friedrich Seifts Resume', u'Infrastructure Engineering Lead
The New York Times Company
January 2008 to January 2011
www.nytimes.com)
I served as the 'Lead' member of the Digital Architecture & Engineering team tasked with setting the direction for all of NYTIMES.com System, Network, Storage infrastructure initiatives. I spent the majority of my days doing
hands-on engineering/implementation and architectural design, while managing business/stake-holder
engagements and concerns.

The New York Times Digital infrastructure was built around a hybrid design utilizing internal and external "cloud"
instances. Serving an average of 65+ million hits per month. The two physical datacenters and cloud environment
operated in concert on a "hot-hot-hot" design via GEOIP/GSLB supporting an in-house development team nearing
150+ developers with the prime directive of delivery the content and supporting a large-scale News room
exceeding 1000+ Editors/Reporters around the globe.

Virtualization & Datacenter:
• Infrastructure consolidation from disparate Xen/Solaris(zones)/Bare Metal to 'Linux' VMWare DRS clusters.
• Federation between the VMware internal privatized cloud and external clouds(Amazon's Xen EC2).
• Migration from SPOF 1000tx to 10000tx copper LACP/trunked VLAN's across VDS's.
